SVGAttributeGlyph-orientation-vertical.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The glyph-orientation-vertical attribute affects the amount that the current text position advances as each glyph is rendered.

remarks.para: When the inline-progression-direction is vertical and the glyph-orientation-vertical results in an orientation angle that is a multiple of 180 degrees, then the current text position is incremented according to the vertical metrics of the glyph. Otherwise, if the angle is not a multiple of 180 degrees, then the current text position is incremented according to the horizontal metrics of the glyph.
This attribute is applied only to text written in a vertical writing-mode.

blockquote.para: Note: As a presentation attribute, glyph-orientation-vertical can be used as a CSS property.
